reviewText: I bought this game for two reasons: it was ridiculously cheap, and I recognised the type of game it was and thought I haven't played one of those in a while".\n\nWhy the thumbs down? There are plenty of flash games on the internet that do this better
date: and of course for free. It's a very simple formula
recommended: and yet this game manages to mess it up.\n\n1.) First time running the game
hoursPlayed: I was treated to a splash screen advertising a different game by the same developer
voteText: complete with embedded youtube video. (I understand they were giving it away for an email address
votesHelpful: this is bad).\n2.) This was followed by a config window for resolution that can't be accessed from within the game.\n3.) Navigating the menus with the mouse was frustrating as the pointer displayed as higher on the screen than it really was. This meant having to guess where the volume bar was to lower it
votesTotal: and in some cases clicking the button above the one I wanted to click to get the desired effect.\n4.) The 'tutorial' level gives you controls
votesFunny: but doesn't really say what they do. I was plonked on a planet that I couldn't leave using thrust alone
commentsCount: instead having to toggle gravdrive first. I'm still not really sure what this actually did.\n5.) Those purple lines. Oh god those purple lines. These are horrific for three massive game-ruining reasons:\na.) They constantly move back and forward in a swaying motion
column16: standing a really good chance of giving you a horrible headache after about 5 minutes.\nb.) As the lines are all parallel and always in the same direction
column17: it makes it really difficult to accurately judge the boundaries of the area they surround. Just from the screenshots you can see this. Look at the stage in the shape of a 'W'. Where do the edges parallel with the lines even start? It's not where they're purple
column18: because the space between them also kills you
column19: and the lines are constantly shifting....\nc.) This is the worst part in my opinion - the purple-lined 'death zone' only kills you if you go a certain way into it
column20: which isn't marked in any way whatsoever. From part of the trailer I thought that maybe just the purple lines themselves would kill you and you could maneouver between them
column21: but this isn't the case. There is an arbitrary distance which you're allowed to travel over the lines. Worse still the game actually depends on this and gives you levels early on that require you to skip those gaps
column22: with no way of knowing how far is too far.\n\nIt frustrates me that a game like this can make any money at all. Bugs can be forgiven
column23: but this is just an absolute masterclass in terrible design.\n\ntl;dr - I spent more time writing this review than playing the game
column24: and I also had more fun."

reviewText:
Gun Rocket is a very cool game, but VERY hard. If you wish to try your patience, you can hardly do better than this.

The premise is to move a rocket through space to a target. The challenge being that space, having no gravity, has no means by which to slow or stop your ship, other than its own rockets. So, you fire your ship's rockets to move, to slow, and to change direction. Generally pretty much all at the same time. Thus the challenge is great.

You do all these things in a contrived, shaped space. As such, not only must you do all the above pretty much concurrently, but you must stay within areas of unusual shapes and proportions. Only one level at the time is available for play (so far, at an early level), but 100 levels are available over the life of the game. You are attempting to succeed in reaching the target, but also with the best time and least fuel consumed. Thus, it's possibe to play with great caution, or hell bent for leather"
date: while consuming fuel rapidly. The feeling of success is substantial!\n\nThere is also a multiplayer aspect
recommended: which I haven't explored. For this price ($1.99US)
hoursPlayed: you can hardly go wrong.\n\nHigh recommendation."
voteText: August 9, 2015
votesTotal: 27 of 33 people (82%) found this review helpful 7 people found this review funny

reviewText: Gun Rocket is not for players that get easily frustrated as it honestly can get a quite annoying at times. While the goal of the missions is very straight forward: Get your rocket to the target destination while staying in the designated area. You can ignite your engines which will give you a speed boost but will also make you drift if you turn around and ignite again. There are no speed up and brake controlls just igniting of engine.\nGetting used to manoeuvering will take some time but once you eventually get used to it (and once you find out that you can touch and even move a bit into the non-allowed areas before getting destroyed) Gun Rocket turns out to be actually a quite nice and at times damn challenging game.

reviewText:
-Quick Review-
Gun Rocket is an indie 2D puzzle game which has over 70 unique puzzles to solve, Gun Rocket is extreemly minimalistic in design and provides several hours of entertainment.


-Detailed breakdown review-
Story: There really isn't any type of story in this game.

Game Play: Once upon there was a game called Astroids, and that's basically how this game controls. you face the direction you want to go, and press up forward button, you can also boost to go faster. There are two additional abilities to consider: A shoot button which fires projectiles (not to damage anything...This isn't an arcade shooter, but to create bumps" or push other objects out of the way) additionally there's a move which will make you imune to gravity for a very short time.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=569605372

There's also Multiplayer
date: but you need to play on LAN.... and friends
recommended:
so I wasn't able to try that part out at all.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=569605525

Achievements: There are no achievements for Gun rocket at this time. There is a scoring system
hoursPlayed: and if you wanted you could be competitive with other players online
voteText:
or even friends.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=569605423

Price Gun rocket is priced at $1.99
helpfulPercent: for a couple hours of entertainment
votesHelpful: that's a fair asking price.\n\nConclusion: In a way Gun Rocket is a nod to some of the very earliest classic games
votesTotal: I found it much easier to play then astroids
votesFunny: but in all honesty I find the game lacking in motivation to keep me playing.\nI recomend this game to anyone who wants to play a minimalistic game for a few hours and then move on to play something else."

reviewText:
So my little brother bought me this game, and I can only assume his motive was to troll me incredibly hard.

Basically you fly a spaceship, asteroid style, and try to dodge a moving purple headache with no easily identifiable hitbox.
The level designs are incredibly repetitive most of the time. There are however, a few very fun and innovative levels, making use of a game mechanic called the gravity drive" in which you can disable the gravity effects on your ship for a few seconds.

Often times you need an extra arm to complete a level because when you press the button to start it
date: you die instantly unless your hands are already on your controls. I cut off someone else' arm and grafted it to my body
recommended: but you could probably just get a friend to help you.\n\nSome of the levels are also just balant lazy level design
hoursPlayed: made to meet the quota of 100 levels. Some levels also make you wait up to 8 seconds before you can even move.\n\nGood for a laugh I guess

reviewText:
At a glance, the simple graphic design would lead many people to pass this game.

But if you are a fan of physics based puzzle games, you won't go wrong with Gun Rocket.
The main mechanic is gravity, or rather the lack of.

Your goal is simply to get your ship from point A to point B using only your thrusters. Simple... except there is no assistance. There is no gyroscope or breaking thrusters. Once you gain momentum you keep that momentum.

One thing I found odd is the only unlockable in the game was the final level. All other stages and levels, as well as 6 ship designs are available as soon as you start playing. This isn't really a bad thing, as it allowed me to skip more challenging stages and return to them later, as well as try out the different ships.

So if you enjoy a nice 2D space puzzle game with gravity challenges, this is a nice fit for you. But be warned, it's not as casual as it appears, as the levels start to get tricky real fast.

reviewText:
This game is a redo of a classic game know as lunar lander. Now the graphics are pretty simple. Also you don't have to land on a pad at a safe angle and velocity. You just need to make it to point A to B while avoiding the danger zones on each stage. Also you still need to maintain your fuel levels.

The nice thing about the game is that there is a couple of ships (I prefer to play as the top hat personally) with their own Properties and shape. This changes their thrusters and boosting power and how they can affectively change in the way the games space gravity work. The game also encourages you to either go and beat your time or beat a level with more fuel saved.

It is a simple game but once you get the hang of your preferred ship's thrusters you can get the hang of it and zip zap and zoom through space.

reviewText:
Even though I've only played 9 minutes, I've gotten completely emersed in this game. The soundtrack is great and gets you right in the zone. Although the graphics are low quality, it still looks and feels like a good game. And let me tell you, the space physics are most likely spot on! It actually feels like you'll never stop once you go in one direction.

My final score for this game is 9/10. The Price is great, although I got this game from somebody on a reddit forum who had about 20 keys for it, it's still probably one of my most favorite small games.

Buy it now!

reviewText:
This game is a redo of a classic game know as lunar lander. Now the graphics are pretty simple. Also you don't have to land on a pad at a safe angle and velocity. You just need to make it to point A to B while avoiding the danger zones on each stage. Also you still need to maintain your fuel levels.

The nice thing about the game is that there is a couple of ships (I prefer to play as the top hat personally) with their own Properties and shape. This changes their thrusters and boosting power and how they can affectively change in the way the games space gravity work. The game also encourages you to either go and beat your time or beat a level with more fuel saved.

It is a simple game but once you get the hang of your preferred ship's thrusters you can get the hang of it and zip zap and zoom through space.

reviewText:
In the end I can't recommend this game.

So what are you getting here?  Well, just what it looks like.  A cheap physics puzzle game with exceptionally bad artwork.

And the physics based thruster puzzles are not bad.  You can waste a few hours going through the levels.  Also the music is very decent.

So why am I not recommending it?  Didn't I know what I was signing up for?  Maybe I did.  Maybe the problem is with me, that when I saw this I was hoping for more rather than what it looked like at face value.  Ultimately I found the game not very fun.  The waving purple lines in the back really started to give me a headache.  The art was in this case so bad it became painful after a while.  Also, hidden in those terrible purple lines are hidden death zones that you just have to guess at.  Even the opening level does not really do much to teach you how to play and is a bit of messing with the controls to get past.

This game is what it appears to be, and nothing more.  If you don't get motion sick from the purple lines you might have fun with it.  I did not.

4/10
